subtitle: About Me!
content:
Hi! I'm Jake Cox, and I'm a Software Engineer and a technology enthusiast. I am a lifelong learner and always looking for new ways to grow both personally and professionally. I live on the Central Coast of California with my amazing wife and 4 kids, and we love to go hiking, swim at the beach, and go camping. I get excited by traveling to new places and discovering food and beer spots to eat and drink with my wife and friends. I like to stay busy by listening to podcasts, watching movies, and playing video games.

One of my crowning achievements was being selected as one of the top 100 technology professionals and winning a trip to New Zealand to view and take part in their up and coming technology sector.

subtitle: Experience!
content:
I'm a Senior Software Engineer, and after years working meaningless jobs, I jump-started my career as a Web Intern at Valley Yellow Pages making minimum wage during the day and stocking groceries at night. I quickly learned the lay of the land and decided I needed an education to make it formal. Working 2 jobs and going to school at night while starting a family, I was committed to make it happen ðŸ¤“!! My education paid off and got me into the IT department at Valley Yellow Pages. When I outgrew my position, I found Lotpath which jettisoned my knowledge and taught me to take ownership of my learning and I took my first steps into a much larger tech world as part of Bitwise Industries.

I graduated college and found more and more opportunities to keep learning and growing. I eventually moved on to Hourglass Systems and brought new life to an old Saas product. I began to take charge and pioneered a completely new product offering for the company and worked directly with the CTO to transform the software to become fully SOC2 and HIPAA compliant (...a major undertaking!).

I eventually found a position in my dream location (the beach) and decided to make it my mission to get there. I applied and waited over a year to be contacted and took the opportunity to move my entire life across the state to start anew. Working at the County of San Luis Obispo was a breath of fresh air with the right work/life balance, a renewed focus on my family, and a serving of the public.

As much as I like working for the County, I am still looking for new areas to be challenged, innovate, and collaborate. I want to find new ways to deliver value, impact, and be an agent of change. I'm ready, are you?
